name: Karl Oskar Medin
obverse: Bust of Oskar Medin facing right. Four branches are along the edge of the medal between the inscriptions.
reverse: At the top, a medallion with a child. This medallion is based off of reliefs designed by Andrea della Robbia on the wall of the Ospedale degli Innocenti children's orphanage in Florence, Italy. Below, an inscription in 4 lines.
description: Karl Oskar Medin was Swedish pediatrician.
He is most famous for his study of poliomyelitis, a condition sometimes known as the Heine-Medin disease.
